intro: Licaria caudata, commonly known as the long-tailed licaria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Its unique appearance and ornamental value make it a popular choice for botanical gardens and collectors.
